intro: Rosa eglanteria var. spineourceolata, commonly known as the spiny rose, is a shrub-like plant native to parts of Asia. It features thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces fragrant pink to red flowers in clusters, typically blooming in summer. Its botanical characteristics include a woody structure and a preference for well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or forested areas, showcasing adaptability to various environmental conditions.
